Term.name: Vin
Term.Desc: A half-skaa street urchin who unknowingly possesses the power of a Mistborn. Primary protagonist. Vulnerable, but strong.

Term.name: Kelsier
Term.Desc: The Survivor of Hathsin, and one of the greatest Mistborn Allomancers of all time. He escaped from the Pits of Hathsin where he had been forced to work as a slave, and wandered the world. After being contacted by a skaa hoping for rebellion, Kelsier strikes up his loyal crew with a new contract: the fall of the Final Empire. Secondary protagonist - the story is partly told from his point of view.

Term.name: Dockson
Term.Desc: aka Dox. Kelsier's long time friend and crewmember. He is not an Allomancer, but keeps the crew operational by means of his organizational and administrative abilities.

Term.name: Hammond
Term.Desc: aka Ham. A member of Kelsier's crew, and a Pewterarm or Thug. Ham enjoys philosophical bouts, especially with Breeze.

Term.name: Ladrian
Term.Desc: aka Breeze. A member of Kelsier's crew, and a Soother. Breeze likes his wine, almost as much as he likes himself.

Term.name: Cladent
Term.Desc: aka Clubs. A member of Kelsier's crew. He is a Coppercloud or Smoker, and he along with the rest of his apprentices are able to shield their hideouts from the Ministry's Allomancers.

Term.name: Lestibournes
Term.Desc: aka Spook. One of Clubs' apprentices, and a Tineye. He hails from the east, and as such speaks with a strange dialect.

Term.name: Lord Ruler
Term.Desc: The ruler and "God" of the Final Empire. Nobody knows who he is or where he came from. All that is known is that since his Ascension, the Deepness was driven back and the world has lost hope.

Term.name: Marsh
Term.Desc: Kelsier's brother and a Seeker. He is willing to take down the Final Empire, no matter the cost.

Term.name: Sazed
Term.Desc: A Terrisman steward to Lord Renoux, and then Vin.

Term.name: Elend Venture
Term.Desc: aka El. A nobleman, and son of Straff Venture. He is heir to the Venture House, though not by the choice of either him nor his father. All Elend wants to do is read, philosophize and antagonize his father

Term.name: Teven Renoux
Term.Desc: A nobleman who is part of Kelsier's crew.

Term.name: Reen
Term.Desc: Vin's older brother

Term.name: Shan Elariel
Term.Desc: a wealthy Lutharian noblewoman from the Elariel House.

Term.name: Camon
Term.Desc: crewleader for a band of thieves

Term.name: Jastes Lekal
Term.Desc: friend of Elend. From House Lekal.

Term.name: Milev
Term.Desc: Camon's second.

Term.name: Kar
Term.Desc: an Inquisitor.

Term.name: Theron
Term.Desc: Skaa theiving crew leader. Colludes with Camon for the scheme at the beginning of the book.

Term.name: Mare
Term.Desc: Kelsier's wife who was killed in the Pits of Hathsin, a Tineye.

Term.name: Rashek
Term.Desc: A historical Terris packman.

Term.name: Prelan Tevidian
Term.Desc: An obligator. Lord Prelan of one of the Ministries.

Term.name: OreSeur
Term.Desc: a Kandra

Term.name: TenSoon
Term.Desc: The Venture family kandra.

Term.name: Lord Thomas Tresting
Term.Desc: Nobleman and lord of Tresting plantation.

Term.name: Kurdon
Term.Desc: Burly taskmaster for Lord Tresting

Term.name: Goodman Tepper
Term.Desc: Skaa elder

Term.name: Goodman Mennis
Term.Desc: skaa elder on the Tresting plantation

Term.name: Ulef
Term.Desc: A member in Camon's band of thieves. Young and gangly.

Term.name: Lord Straff Venture
Term.Desc: Head of house Venture. Elend's father.

Term.name: Prelan Laird
Term.Desc: an obliagator. Senior bureaucrat in the Ministry's Canton of Finance.

Term.name: Yeden
Term.Desc: A revolutionary. Hires Kelsier to build him an army.

Term.name: Hign prelan Arriev
Term.Desc: from the ministry of Finance.

Term.name: Disten
Term.Desc: A member of Camon's crew.

Term.name: Gemmel
Term.Desc: A mentor of Kelsier, taught him about iron pulling and steel pushing.

Term.name: Lord Rian Strobe
Term.Desc: First noble to ask Vin (Valette) to dance.

Term.name: Lord Telden Hasting
Term.Desc: One of Elend's friends.

Term.name: Lady Kliss
Term.Desc: A socialite prone to gossip.

Term.name: Bendal
Term.Desc: A steel inquisitor

Term.name: Lord Idren Seeris
Term.Desc: cousin to house Elariel

Term.name: Lord Tegas
Term.Desc: Possible ally of house Venture. Has a daughter that Straff would like to match up with Elend.

Term.name: The Pits of Hathsin
Term.Desc: A place where Skaa criminals are sent to work.

Term.name: Mansion Renoux
Term.Desc: Home of House Renoux, located in the city of Fellise.

Term.name: Western Dominance
Term.Desc: Fadrex City is an important cross roads city in the Western Dominance. Although all cities outside of Luthadel are forbidden from having walls, Fadrex City has a natural rock formation that makes it very defensible.

Term.name: Northern Dominance
Term.Desc: Urteau is a key crossroads city in the Northern Dominance. It was the traditional seat of House Venture although the family is based mainly in the capital.

Term.name: Terris Dominance
Term.Desc: Terris is the ancestral home of the Terrismen. It is a mountainous region located north of the Northern Dominance. The Terris Dominance is the only Dominance to retain its original name.

Term.name: Central Dominance
Term.Desc: Luthadel is the capital of the Central Dominance and the entire Final Empire. Luthadel is the heart of the Lord Ruler's power, as well as the site of his palace, Kredik Shaw.

Term.name: Allomancy
Term.Desc: The process of burning metals.

Term.name: Allomancer
Term.Desc: A person able to burn one or all of the Allomantic metals.

Term.name: Allomantic metals
Term.Desc: Eight basic Allomantic metals are iron, steel, tin, pewter, brass, zinc, copper and bronze. The ninth Allomantic metal is gold. The tenth Allomantic metal is Atium. There is rumored to be an eleventh and maybe even twelfth Allomantic metal (names for these are not mentioned in the novel).

Term.name: Brass
Term.Desc: External mental pulling metal. A person using this metal is able to Soothe another person's emotions, dampening them and making particular emotions less powerful.

Term.name: Bronze
Term.Desc: Internal mental pushing metal. A person burning this metal is able to sense when nearby people are using Allomancy

Term.name: Coinshot
Term.Desc: A Misting who can burn steel.

Term.name: Copper
Term.Desc: Internal mental pulling metal. A person burning copper gives off an invisible cloud that protects anyone inside of it from the senses of a Seeker.

Term.name: Lurcher
Term.Desc: A Misting who can burn iron.

Term.name: Mistborn
Term.Desc: An Allomancer able to use all Allomantic metals.

Term.name: Misting
Term.Desc: An Allomancer able to use only one of the Allomantic metals.

Term.name: Pewter
Term.Desc: Internal physical pushing metal. A person burning pewter enhances the physical attributes of their body.

Term.name: Pewterarm
Term.Desc: A Misting who can burn Pewter.

Term.name: Iron
Term.Desc: External physical pulling metal. A person burning iron can see translucent blue lines pointing to nearby sources of metal.

Term.name: Rioter
Term.Desc: A Misting who can burn zinc.

Term.name: Seeker
Term.Desc: A Misting who can burn bronze.

Term.name: Smoker
Term.Desc: A Misting who can burn copper.

Term.name: Soother
Term.Desc: A Misting who can burn brass.

Term.name: Steel
Term.Desc: External physical pushing metal. A person burning iron can see translucent blue lines pointing to nearby sources of metal.

Term.name: Tin
Term.Desc: Internal physical pulling metal. A person burning tin gains enhanced senses.

Term.name: Tineye
Term.Desc: A Misting who can burn tin.

Term.name: Thug
Term.Desc: A misting who can burn pewter, aka Pewterarm.

Term.name: Zinc
Term.Desc: External mental pushing metal. A person burning zinc can Riot another person's emotions, inflaming them and making particular emotions more powerful.
